data.title: What does a compilation or various artists release mean?
data.meta_description: Compilated doesn’t mean it’s complicated. If a release with multiple tracks has four or more primary artists anywhere on it, even if they’re on different tracks, you’ll need to classify it as a compilation or various artists release.  An example of a compilation album would be the Now That’s What I Call Music! series. You can find […]
data.text:
Compilated doesn’t mean it’s complicated.

If a release with multiple tracks has four or more primary artists anywhere on it, even if they’re on different tracks, you’ll need to classify it as a compilation or various artists release.

An example of a compilation album would be the Now That’s What I Call Music! series.

You can find out more on distributing this type of release with RouteNote by clicking here.

For some various artist release formatting tips, click here.

Have a read of our blog post on Compilation and Various Artists releases by clicking here.

Check out the full RouteNote Style Guide here!

If you have any further queries, feel free to get in touch with us!
